meanings.sent1: His illiberality towards sharing his toys made the other children sad.
meanings.sent2: The illiberality of the boss was evident when he refused to consider any new ideas.
meanings.sent3: The illiberality of the grumpy old man extended even to not sharing the park bench.
meanings.sent4: Her illiberality was like a locked door, shutting out any new perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The illiberality of the dictator stifled creativity and progress in the country.

meanings.definition: The quality of being narrow-minded or intolerant.
meanings.sent1: The illiberality of his views made it hard for him to accept different opinions.
meanings.sent2: Her illiberality towards other cultures was evident in her refusal to try new foods.
meanings.sent3: The illiberality of the picky eater extended to only eating one type of sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The illiberality of the closed-minded individual was like a high wall blocking out new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The illiberality of the group led to them missing out on valuable learning opportunities.
